intro: Casearia melliodora, commonly known as the golden casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and can grow up to several meters in height. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
